speaker: FENTON

string: You would have married her most shamefully,
speaker: FENTON

string: Where there was no proportion held in love.
speaker: FENTON

string: The truth is, she and I, long since contracted,
speaker: FENTON

string: Are now so sure that nothing can dissolve us.
speaker: FENTON

string: The offence is holy that she hath committed;
speaker: FENTON

string: And this deceit loses the name of craft,
speaker: FENTON

string: Of disobedience, or unduteous title,
speaker: FENTON

string: Since therein she doth evitate and shun
speaker: FENTON

string: A thousand irreligious cursed hours,
speaker: FENTON

string: Which forced marriage would have brought upon her.
speaker: FENTON

string: FORD
speaker: FORD

string: Stand not amazed; here is no remedy:
speaker: FORD

string: In love the heavens themselves do guide the state;
speaker: FORD

string: Money buys lands, and wives are sold by fate.
speaker: FORD

string: FALSTAFF
speaker: FALSTAFF

string: I am glad, though you have ta'en a special stand to
speaker: FALSTAFF

string: strike at me, that your arrow hath glanced.
speaker: FALSTAFF

string: PAGE
speaker: PAGE

string: Well, what remedy? Fenton, heaven give thee joy!
speaker: PAGE

string: What cannot be eschew'd must be embraced.
speaker: PAGE

string: FALSTAFF
speaker: FALSTAFF

string: When night-dogs run, all sorts of deer are chased.
speaker: FALSTAFF

string: MISTRESS PAGE
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE

string: Well, I will muse no further. Master Fenton,
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE

string: Heaven give you many, many merry days!
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE

string: Good husband, let us every one go home,
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE

string: And laugh this sport o'er by a country fire;
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE

string: Sir John and all.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE

string: FORD
speaker: FORD

string: Let it be so. Sir John,
speaker: FORD

string: To Master Brook you yet shall hold your word
speaker: FORD

string: For he tonight shall lie with Mistress Ford.
speaker: FORD

string: Exeunt
